channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Festival d’Automne in Paris Honors Rabih Mroué and Lina Majdalanie
item.description: A retrospective in Paris honors Lina Majdalanie and Rabih Mroué, whose theater works have examined the region’s troubles for decades.

item.title: Miami is at risk of a housing bubble
item.description: “Miami now shows the highest bubble risk among the cities in this study,” UBS said.

item.title: Live Updates: Hezbollah Fires on Tel Aviv; Israeli General Hints at Use of Ground Troops
item.description: Israeli defenses shot down the missile aimed at Tel Aviv, but its firing was a sign of Hezbollah’s long reach after days of withering Israeli strikes....

item.title: Trump Is an Open Book for Closed Minds
item.description: How is it possible that the former president has a reasonable chance of winning the election despite all that voters now know about him?

item.title: We keep celebrating low unemployment—but data shows jobs and economic activity have been shifting to big business
item.description: A one-size-fits-all approach has dominated economic policy and has favored bigger, more established, and less dynamic businesses.

item.title: Astronomers Spot a Black Hole with a Cosmic Wingspan
item.description: Astronomers have discovered a black hole emitting energy in jets longer than the width of 140 Milky Way galaxies.

item.title: Ozempic may help manage opioid addiction: study
item.description: Patients on semaglutide were less than half as likely to overdose as those on insulin.

item.title: Mayor Adams Names New Schools Chancellor, as Chaos and Inquiries Swirl
item.description: The quick selection of Melissa Aviles-Ramos to lead the New York City school system seemed intended to quell a deepening crisis that has seen several ...

item.title: Wells Fargo employee dying at her desk ‘sheds light on the reality of what it means’ to work at the bank, says union
item.description: You're either killing yourself or you're not enough,” an employee told the union.

item.title: Account suspensions have tripled on X since Elon Musk took over
item.description: First transparency report since 2022 shows scope of change.

item.title: Senate Report Details Secret Service Failings at Trump Rally Shooting
item.description: A Senate committee report on the Secret Service’s inability to protect the former president at a July event depicts a lack of individual responsibilit...

item.title: Hezbollah’s Military Capability: What We Know
item.description: The Iran-backed militants have perhaps the largest arsenal of any armed group in the world, excluding governments, experts say.

item.title: U.N. Live Updates: Zelensky Calls for Global Focus to Stay on Ukraine
item.description: To reverse Russia’s steady battlefield advances, the Ukrainian leader needs the support of Western allies whose attention is also demanded by other wa...

item.title: As School Threats Proliferate, More Than 700 Students Are
item.description: The number of threats after a Georgia school shooting this month is much higher than usual, many officials said. In response, some have cracked down w...

item.title: Meta Unveils New Virtual Reality Headset and Other Products
item.description: At an event in Silicon Valley, Meta exhibited a range of products meant to blend the real world and virtual reality, with a healthy dose of A.I.
